abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Quality Education in
            Rural Areas of Moldova Project for Moldova were as follows:
            outcomes were moderately unsatisfactory, risk to development
            outcome was low, Bank performance was moderately
            unsatisfactory, and Borrower performance was moderately
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: project design
            must be based on a well-defined results framework (RF),
            allowing capturing key results influenced by the project.
            Top-down and bottom-up approaches are needed for the
            efficiency reforms to be successful. The assessment showed
            that school autonomy provides a number of advantages as part
            of a comprehensive strategy for school and education system
            improvements, including the incentive to use funds more
            efficiently. Adequate resourcing for capacity-building
            activities is fundamental. The risks section emphasized that
            the ambitious plan of school network rationalization can
            impact the ministry of education's (MoEd's)
            capacity to implement the project.
